text: they say it's the bride's prerogative to
be late for her wedding but this is
getting ridiculous 80 years after first
falling in love martina lopez and jose
manuel really finally said I do in the
eyes of God the groom 103 the blushing
bride a mere sapling at 99 a ceremony
held in their back garden passing off
without a hitch even if they needed a
little help with the ring if they though
lovely Metallica similarly it's the
first time I'm marrying someone of this
age and I'm very happy to marry these
two senior there's no denying this has
been a very long engagement Jose and
Martina met and fell in love
in 1933 the same year Adolf Hitler
became Chancellor of Germany and
Franklin Roosevelt took office as
president of the United States they did
have a civil wedding half a century ago
around the time President Kennedy was
assassinated but they never bothered
with a religious ceremony until now my
children wanted us to get married they
told me that is what they wanted I'm
happy because all but two of my children
are here all the rest are here and not
just the children there's 50
grandchildren 35 great-grandchildren and
20 great-great grandchildren
no doubt the reception was a little
crowded
Tim Allman BBC news
